subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Mitohormesis Theory
Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Mitohormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mild mitochondrial ROS elevation triggering adaptive stress responses and systemic mitokine signaling promoting longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Mitohormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mild mitochondrial stress increasing ROS as signals to induce protective mechanisms and extend lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Mitohormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial unfolded protein response and mitohormesis as key mitochondrial signaling pathways regulating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Mitohormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mild mitochondrial uncoupling inducing integrated stress response and mitokine-mediated systemic longevity effects.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Mitohormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitochondrial ROS production and species longevity, focusing on mitochondrial ROS as a driver and modulator of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Mitohormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial DNA mutations caused by ROS and bioenergetic decline as central to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Mitohormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mitochondrial ROS generation, mtDNA damage, and mitochondrial dysfunction driving cardiovascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Mitohormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS overproduction, antioxidant enzyme decline, and p66Shc regulation linking mitochondrial ROS to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Signaling and Mitohormesis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explores mitochondrial electron transport chain as main ROS source and its variation across species affecting longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS-induced protein oxidation via disulfide bond formation impairing Ca2+ signaling and cellular function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights dual role of ROS in signaling and damage, emphasizing redox homeostasis and antioxidant defenses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes exercise-induced ROS hormesis where moderate ROS act as signaling molecules triggering adaptive responses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows dietary restriction reduces free radical and lipid peroxide production, linking ROS and redox balance to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details plasma membrane redox system and antioxidant defenses mitigating ROS-induced protein and lipid damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidant-antioxidant imbalance causing molecular damage and the complex role of oxidative stress signaling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Presents integrated view of ROS accumulation, oxidative damage, and antioxidant defense imbalance driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Uses yeast model to study antioxidant potential and oxidative stress as causal driver of aging via macromolecular damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes antioxidant and insulin/IGF-1 signaling pathways mitigating ROS accumulation and oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Uses erythrocytes to study oxidative stress biomarkers and age-related decline in antioxidant enzymes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses antioxidant supplementation to enhance defenses and reduce oxidative damage in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Genetic evidence supports oxidative damage accumulation as causal mechanism of aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Free radical accumulation overwhelms repair capacity causing molecular damage and functional decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Redox Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on lipid peroxidation and antioxidant enzyme activity changes with age affecting membrane integrity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nrf2-Mediated Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes SKN-1/NRF2 transcription factor activation enhancing antioxidant enzyme expression and lifespan extension.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nrf2-Mediated Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights Nrf2 as master regulator of antioxidant defenses and mitochondrial homeostasis influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nrf2-Mediated Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes Nrf2 and NF-κB interplay regulating oxidative stress and inflammation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nrf2-Mediated Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative stress, inflammation, and immunosenescence with transcriptional regulation involving NF-κB and Nrf2.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nrf2-Mediated Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on macrophage-driven oxidative-inflammatory stress and lipofuscin accumulation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nrf2-Mediated Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates oxidative stress and inflammation with immune system dysfunction and mitochondrial ROS.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nrf2-Mediated Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details oxidative-inflammatory stress in immune cells as predictive markers of lifespan and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Nrf2-Mediated Antioxidant Defense Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Melatonin acts as endogenous antioxidant reducing oxidative/nitrosative stress, linking to aging mitigation.
